Package net.sourceforge.plantuml.project.ngm.math

Class Segment

java.lang.Object
net.sourceforge.plantuml.project.ngm.math.Segment
public final class Segment extends Object
A constant workload segment over a time interval.

A segment represents a time interval where the workload value remains constant. The boundary convention is: both bounds are exclusive, denoted as ]start, end[ (or equivalently (start, end) in some notations). This symmetric design simplifies bidirectional iteration.

Segments can be either TimeDirection.FORWARD or TimeDirection.BACKWARD:

  • FORWARD: start is chronologically before end (used for forward iteration through time)
  • BACKWARD: start is chronologically after end (used for backward iteration through time)

In both cases, both start and end are exclusive bounds. This symmetric convention ensures that boundary instants are never "inside" a segment, which simplifies reasoning about segment adjacency and splitting.

Think of it as a time traveler: they travel from start toward end, but never actually stand on either boundary instant. The segment contains all instants strictly between the two bounds. For FORWARD segments, travel is into the future. For BACKWARD segments, travel is into the past.

The value may be zero to explicitly model periods with no assigned workload.

Instances are created via the factory methods forward(LocalDateTime, LocalDateTime, Fraction) and backward(LocalDateTime, LocalDateTime, Fraction).

See Also:
  • TimeDirection
  • Fraction

  • Method Details

    • forward

      public static Segment forward(LocalDateTime start, LocalDateTime end, Fraction value)
      Creates a forward segment where start is chronologically before end.

      The segment represents the time interval ]start, end[ for forward iteration. Both bounds are exclusive.

      Parameters:
      start - the exclusive start bound (chronologically earlier)
      end - the exclusive end bound (chronologically later)
      value - the constant workload value for this segment
      Returns:
      a new forward segment
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if any argument is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if start is not chronologically before end

    • backward

      public static Segment backward(LocalDateTime start, LocalDateTime end, Fraction value)
      Creates a backward segment where start is chronologically after end.

      The segment represents the time interval ]start, end[ for backward iteration, where start is the later instant and end is the earlier instant. Both bounds are exclusive.

      Parameters:
      start - the exclusive start bound (chronologically later)
      end - the exclusive end bound (chronologically earlier)
      value - the constant workload value for this segment
      Returns:
      a new backward segment
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if any argument is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if end is not chronologically before start

    • getTimeDirection

      public TimeDirection getTimeDirection()
      Returns the direction of this segment.
      Returns:
      TimeDirection.FORWARD if start is chronologically before end, TimeDirection.BACKWARD if start is chronologically after end

    • startExclusive

      public LocalDateTime startExclusive()
      Returns the exclusive start bound of this segment.

      For TimeDirection.FORWARD segments, this is the chronologically earlier instant. For TimeDirection.BACKWARD segments, this is the chronologically later instant.

      This bound is exclusive: the returned instant is not considered part of the segment.

      Returns:
      the exclusive start bound

    • endExclusive

      public LocalDateTime endExclusive()
      Returns the exclusive end bound of this segment.

      For TimeDirection.FORWARD segments, this is the chronologically later instant. For TimeDirection.BACKWARD segments, this is the chronologically earlier instant.

      This bound is exclusive: the returned instant is not considered part of the segment.

      Returns:
      the exclusive end bound

    • getValue

      public Fraction getValue()
      Returns the constant workload value of this segment.
      Returns:
      the workload value, never null

    • split

      public Segment[] split(LocalDateTime time)
      Splits this segment into two contiguous segments at the given instant.

      The split instant time must lie strictly within the bounds of this segment (exclusive of both start and end).

      The returned array always contains exactly two segments with the same direction as this segment:

      • the first segment spans from start (exclusive) to time (exclusive),
      • the second segment spans from time (exclusive) to end (exclusive).

      Both resulting segments carry the same value as this segment. The two segments are guaranteed to be contiguous and non-overlapping.

      Parameters:
      time - the instant at which to split this segment
      Returns:
      an array of exactly two segments resulting from the split
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if time is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if time lies outside the bounds of this segment or is equal to start or end

    • includes

      public boolean includes(LocalDateTime time)
      Checks whether the given instant lies strictly within this segment.

      This method excludes both boundaries. The check is (start, end) â€” exclusive on both ends.

      • TimeDirection.FORWARD: start < time < end
      • TimeDirection.BACKWARD: end < time < start
      Parameters:
      time - the instant to check
      Returns:
      true if time lies strictly between start and end (exclusive on both ends), false otherwise
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if time is null

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this segment.

      The format is: DIRECTION ]start, end[ value=V where DIRECTION is either FORWARD or BACKWARD.

      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of this segment

    • intersection

      public static Segment intersection(List<Segment> segments)
      Computes the intersection of multiple segments using multiplication to combine their values.

      The intersection is defined as the overlapping time range shared by all provided segments. If no such overlapping range exists, an exception is thrown.

      The value of the resulting segment is computed by multiplying the values of all intersecting segments.

      Parameters:
      segments - the list of segments to intersect
      Returns:
      a new Segment representing the intersection of the input segments with the combined value
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if segments is empty or if no overlapping range exists among the segments
      NullPointerException - if segments is null

    • intersection

      public static Segment intersection(List<Segment> segments, BiFunction<Fraction,Fraction,Fraction> valueFunction)
      Computes the intersection of multiple segments.

      The intersection is defined as the overlapping time range shared by all provided segments. If no such overlapping range exists, an exception is thrown.

      All segments must have the same TimeDirection. The resulting segment will have the same direction as the input segments.

      The value of the resulting segment is computed by applying the provided valueFunction to the values of all intersecting segments.

      Parameters:
      segments - the list of segments to intersect
      valueFunction - a function that combines two Fraction values into one; this function is applied iteratively to combine the values of all intersecting segments
      Returns:
      a new Segment representing the intersection of the input segments with the combined value
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if segments is empty, if segments have different directions, or if no overlapping range exists among the segments
      NullPointerException - if segments or valueFunction is null

    • intersection

      public static Segment intersection(Segment[] segments)
      Computes the intersection of multiple segments using multiplication to combine their values.

      Convenience overload for array inputs. Delegates to intersection(List).

      Parameters:
      segments - the array of segments to intersect
      Returns:
      a new Segment representing the intersection
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if segments is empty, if segments have different directions, or if no overlapping range exists
      NullPointerException - if segments is null
      See Also:
      • intersection(List)

    • intersection

      public static Segment intersection(Segment[] segments, BiFunction<Fraction,Fraction,Fraction> valueFunction)
      Computes the intersection of multiple segments with a custom value function.

      Convenience overload for array inputs. Delegates to intersection(List, BiFunction).

      Parameters:
      segments - the array of segments to intersect
      valueFunction - a function that combines two Fraction values
      Returns:
      a new Segment representing the intersection
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if segments is empty, if segments have different directions, or if no overlapping range exists
      NullPointerException - if segments or valueFunction is null
      See Also:
      • intersection(List, BiFunction)
